findings.title: Critical Error Messages Lack Accessibility Context
findings.description: Error messages output via fmt.Println() provide no accessible context for screen readers or automated monitoring systems. Network errors expose system information without proper accessibility formatting.
findings.impact: Users with visual impairments using screen readers cannot understand error context. Automated accessibility tools cannot parse error severity or recovery options.
findings.remediation: Implement structured error output with accessibility attributes including severity levels, context descriptions, and recovery guidance
findings.security_implication: Error information disclosure without proper user context could expose system details to unauthorized users

findings.title: Service Status Information Not Accessible to Assistive Technologies
findings.description: GPIO pin status and counter values are logged to stdout without structured accessibility formatting. Users with disabilities cannot access real-time service status through assistive technologies.
findings.evidence: fmt.Printf("%s : (epoch %d) : read %d from gpio %d\n", time.Now(), time.Now().Unix(), value, pin)
findings.impact: Critical service monitoring information inaccessible to users with visual impairments. No machine-readable status format for accessibility tools.
findings.remediation: Implement structured logging with accessibility metadata and optional accessible status endpoints
findings.security_implication: Lack of accessible monitoring may prevent security-conscious users from detecting anomalous behavior

findings.title: Documentation Missing Alternative Text for Critical Diagrams
findings.description: Wiring schematic and power graph images in documentation lack alternative text descriptions, making essential setup information inaccessible to screen reader users.
findings.impact: Users with visual impairments cannot access critical hardware setup information, creating security risks from improper installation.
findings.remediation: Add comprehensive alt text describing wiring connections, pin assignments, and safety considerations
findings.security_implication: Inaccessible wiring instructions could lead to unsafe electrical connections

findings.title: Network Service Configuration Lacks Accessible Documentation
findings.description: TCP service configuration details (port 9001, 0.0.0.0 binding) are embedded in code without accessible configuration documentation for users with cognitive or visual disabilities.
findings.evidence: LISTEN_HOST = "0.0.0.0" // tcp interface to serve counter on
findings.impact: Users with disabilities cannot easily understand or modify security-critical network configuration without reading source code.
findings.remediation: Create accessible configuration documentation with clear security implications and modification guidance
findings.security_implication: Hidden network configuration may prevent security-conscious users from properly securing the service

findings.title: Command-Line Interface Lacks Accessibility Features
findings.description: Application provides no command-line help, usage information, or accessibility options. No support for screen reader compatibility or keyboard navigation assistance.
findings.evidence: func main() { // No argument parsing or help system
findings.impact: Users with disabilities cannot discover available options, configuration parameters, or accessibility features.
findings.remediation: Implement comprehensive help system with accessibility options and screen reader compatibility
findings.security_implication: Lack of help system may lead to insecure configuration by users unfamiliar with security implications

findings.title: Boot Configuration Instructions Not Accessible
findings.description: rc.local boot configuration instructions lack accessibility formatting and don't provide alternative accessible setup methods for users with disabilities.
findings.impact: Users with visual or cognitive impairments may struggle with system-level configuration, potentially creating security vulnerabilities.
findings.remediation: Provide accessible step-by-step configuration guide with systemd service alternatives
findings.security_implication: Inaccessible setup instructions may lead to insecure deployment configurations

findings.title: No Accessible Error Recovery Guidance
findings.description: Application terminates on errors without providing accessible recovery instructions or alternative access methods for users with disabilities.
findings.evidence: os.Exit(1) // FIXME should not Exit() here
findings.impact: Users with disabilities have no accessible path to recover from service failures or understand error resolution.
findings.remediation: Implement graceful error handling with accessible recovery guidance and alternative access methods
findings.security_implication: Abrupt service termination without recovery guidance may leave security monitoring gaps

findings.title: Missing Semantic Structure in Documentation
findings.description: README documentation lacks proper heading hierarchy and semantic markup for screen reader navigation. Technical sections not properly structured for assistive technologies.
findings.impact: Screen reader users cannot efficiently navigate documentation to find security-relevant configuration information.
findings.remediation: Restructure documentation with proper heading hierarchy and semantic markup
findings.security_implication: Poor navigation may cause users to miss critical security configuration steps

findings.title: Network Access Data Not Accessible via Standard Protocols
findings.description: Power meter data only accessible via raw TCP connection without accessible protocols or formats for assistive technologies or accessibility tools.
findings.impact: Users with disabilities cannot access power consumption data through standard accessibility tools or screen readers.
findings.remediation: Provide accessible data access methods including HTTP endpoints with structured JSON responses
findings.security_implication: Limited access methods may force users to implement insecure workarounds

findings.title: No Accessibility Metadata in Service Information
findings.description: Service startup messages and status information lack accessibility metadata such as severity levels, categories, or structured format for assistive technologies.
findings.impact: Users with disabilities cannot understand service status or distinguish between informational and critical messages.
findings.remediation: Add structured logging with accessibility attributes and severity indicators
findings.security_implication: Unclear status information may prevent detection of security-related service state changes

findings.title: Hardware Requirements Not Accessible to Cognitive Disabilities
findings.description: GPIO pin and hardware setup requirements presented in technical format without simplified explanations for users with cognitive disabilities or limited technical background.
findings.evidence: Reads from GPIO 27 which is hardware pin 13 on a Raspberry Pi B+
findings.impact: Users with cognitive disabilities may struggle to understand hardware setup requirements, potentially creating safety or security issues.
findings.remediation: Provide simplified hardware setup guide with visual aids and step-by-step accessible instructions
findings.security_implication: Misunderstood hardware requirements could lead to unsafe electrical connections

findings.title: No Accessibility Testing or Validation Framework
findings.description: Project lacks accessibility testing framework, WCAG compliance validation, or accessibility documentation for inclusive design considerations.
findings.evidence: No accessibility testing targets in build process
findings.impact: No systematic approach to ensure accessibility compliance or identify accessibility security vulnerabilities.
findings.remediation: Implement accessibility testing framework with automated WCAG compliance validation
findings.security_implication: Lack of accessibility testing may hide security vulnerabilities that affect users with disabilities

immediate_actions: Add alternative text to all documentation images with wiring and safety information
Implement structured error messaging with accessibility attributes
Create accessible command-line help system with usage guidance
short_term_improvements: Restructure documentation with proper semantic markup
Add accessibility metadata to all service status messages
Create simplified setup guide for users with cognitive disabilities
long_term_accessibility_strategy: Create accessible monitoring dashboard for power consumption data
Establish accessibility security review process for all updates

critical_gaps: Error messages expose system information without accessible context
Network configuration hidden from users who need accessible documentation
Service failures provide no accessible recovery path
security_through_accessibility: Accessible documentation reduces risk of insecure configurations
Clear error messages help users identify security issues
Structured data access prevents insecure workaround implementations
